solution_line_template: {num_guest_cars} cars are parked around for the party, {num_guest_cars} x {wheels_per_car} wheels each car = <<{num_guest_cars}*{wheels_per_car}={guest_car_wheels}>>{guest_car_wheels} wheels total.

Dylan's parents both have a car with {wheels_per_car} wheels each, {num_parents_cars} x {wheels_per_car} = <<{wheels_per_car}*{num_parents_cars}={parents_car_wheels}>>{parents_car_wheels} more wheels.
Combined, there are {guest_car_wheels} + {parents_car_wheels} = <<{guest_car_wheels}+{parents_car_wheels}={total_wheels}>>{total_wheels} wheels total on the Dylan family property.
